availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lewis Lettig Pinkerton (Woodford County, Kentucky minister and soldier)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky minister and soldier. Maryland native. Married to Sarah Boal Pinkerton in Butler County, Ohio on March 19, 1833. Father of William W. Pinkerton, Virginia L. Pinkerton, Burnett S. Pinkerton, James P. Pinkerton, Samuel D. Pinkerton, L.M. Pinkerton, and Mary B. Pinkerton. Founder of Midway University, Midway, Kentucky, in 1847. Clergyman in Woodford County, Kentucky in 1850. Minister in Woodford County, Kentucky in 1860. Professor of Belles-Lettres, History, and Political Philosophy at Kentucky University in 1861. Served in the 11th Kentucky Cavalry (U.S.A.) as Assistant Surgeon from August 13, 1862 to May 28, 1863. Owned five enslaved individuals in Woodford County in 1850.

ab.bibl:
